sentences: Jay Barnet Beckenstein (born May 14, 1951) is an American saxophonist, composer, producer, and the co-founder of the band Spyro Gyra.
Beckenstein was born in Long Island, New York, to a Jewish family.
He started playing the piano at age five when he moved to Farmingdale, New York.
In his senior year of high school, he and his family moved to Germany.
He attended and graduated from Nurnberg American High School in 1969.
He has said that being Jewish in Germany was positive at the time.
He received a college degree in music from the University at Buffalo in 1973.
In 2000, Beckenstein released his first solo album, Eye Contact, which charted No. 23 on the Top Contemporary Jazz Albums.

Beckenstein played the saxophone solo on American progressive metal band Dream Theater's "Another Day", from the album Images and Words, and single version of song "Through her Eyes", from the album Metropolis Pt. 2: Scenes from a Memory.
He also played a solo part in "Take Away My Pain" on the live album Once in a Livetime as well as "Another Day" during the performance of Metropolis 2000: Scenes from New York.
